title.native: 山田くんとLv999の恋をする
title.romaji: Yamada-kun to Lv999 no Koi wo Suru
title.english: My Love Story with Yamada-kun at Lv999

description:
Akane Kinoshita, a female college student, faces the absolute worst situation when she ends up breaking up with her boyfriend after he has an affair with a woman he met playing an online game. While relieving her stress by rampaging through the open hunting grounds of an online game, Akane spills everything about her heartbreak to “Yamada”, a player she met by chance who happens to be in the same guild. “I don't care,” is his curt reply. But when Akane gets a makeover and joins an offline event to get back at her ex-boyfriend, she hears those dreadful words again. And that was Akane's fateful encounter with “Yamada”─！

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Minha História de Amor com Yamada-kun Nível 999
รักสุดฟินเลเวล 999 กับยามาดะคุง
Mon histoire d'amour avec Yamada à Lv999
和山田談場 Lv999 的戀愛

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: E-Sports
tags.description: Prominently features professional video game competitions, tournaments, players, etc.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

title.native: 山田くんとLv999の恋をする

node.description:
Asaka joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) after graduating from Osaka Designers' College. There his first job was working as an assistant director for [Toshio Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/117533/) on [Phoenix: Yamato Chapter](https://anilist.co/anime/2999/). Later he made his debut as an episode director on [Yawara!](https://anilist.co/anime/691/), and soon after as a director on [Pops](https://anilist.co/anime/2093). His notable works include [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/), [Nana](https://anilist.co/anime/877/), [Chihayafuru](https://anilist.co/anime/10800/), and [My Love Story!!](https://anilist.co/anime/20946/) among others.

Many of his works take on a female perspective for the telling of the story, with a feminine protagonist as the central focus. This has contributed to him becoming the main director at Madhouse for handling the more serious series featuring female characters or targeting the female market.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/256771/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱田邦彦) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/guresam0511) 

Often works with [Morio Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100921/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4006951) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/micromicrophone/)

A Japanese musician, lyricist, composer, arranger and the bandmaster of [Clammbon](https://anilist.co/staff/114171/).

__Members:__
- Maguro Taniguchi (lead vocals, rhythm guitar) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonmaguro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/taniguchi_maguro)
- Hayato Koga (lead guitar, backing vocals) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboontuna) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboontuna)
- Takahiro Koizumi (drums) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonkoicha)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboon_official_insta) |  [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kanaboon) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/KANABOONVEVO/) | [Official Website](https://sp.kanaboon.jp/) 

A Japanese rock band formed in 2008, currently associated with Ki/oon Music. They've had four albums reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Albums Chart. They have also had five singles reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Singles Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](https://www.kitazawayuho.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/poppoexpress)

__Yuuho Kitazawa__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, guitarist and former member of the band [the peggies](https://anilist.co/staff/132642/the-peggies).

[Official Website](http://www.kiyoshiryujin.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryujin_kiyoshi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kiyoshiryujin/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5IvOWrKPZ83NNDSy9maFwQ)

__Ryuujin  Kiyoshi__ is a singer and songwriter, born in Yodogawa-ku, Osaka, Japan.
**Shimizu Tomoyuki (清水友幸)** is a Japanese art director and background artist.
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://x.com/Cobalt1604)

Originating from MADHOUSE.

Freelance director. Formerly affiliated with MADHOUSE, Production IMS, XEBEC and David Production.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/256771/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱田邦彦) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/guresam0511) 

Often works with [Morio Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100921/).

Asaka joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) after graduating from Osaka Designers' College. There his first job was working as an assistant director for [Toshio Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/117533/) on [Phoenix: Yamato Chapter](https://anilist.co/anime/2999/). Later he made his debut as an episode director on [Yawara!](https://anilist.co/anime/691/), and soon after as a director on [Pops](https://anilist.co/anime/2093). His notable works include [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/), [Nana](https://anilist.co/anime/877/), [Chihayafuru](https://anilist.co/anime/10800/), and [My Love Story!!](https://anilist.co/anime/20946/) among others.

Many of his works take on a female perspective for the telling of the story, with a feminine protagonist as the central focus. This has contributed to him becoming the main director at Madhouse for handling the more serious series featuring female characters or targeting the female market.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
